comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Richard Arthur Norton, I was puzzled that your wikipedia page put the location of Ratseys as at Gosport, given that the current company website puts the Cowes address everywhere. sportsillustrated.cnn.com/vault/article/magazine/MAG10022... has a good piece on company history, including the following quote from Ernest Ratsey. "As for the Lapthorn part of it, the Lapthorns had a loft in Gosport and used to compete with the Ratsey loft in Cowes. They finally amalgamated in 1880 and the loft in Gosport was known as Lapthorn & Ratseys and at Cowes it was Ratseys & Lapthorn."

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: JE Piper: www.herreshoff.org/achof/thomas_w_ratsey.html suggests that the loft was founded at "Robert Jacob's City Island boatyard in 1902." So it's probably the same place you knew. A pity you can't do a then-and-now match to this one!!
